text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/8ce4b7ed85a7c6499bea5eb1312c85ee7a00e364|patch 8.2.1384: no ATTENTION prompt for :vimgrep first match file>
patch 8.2.1384: no ATTENTION prompt for :vimgrep first match file

Problem:    No ATTENTION prompt for :vimgrep first match file.
Solution:   When there is an existing swap file do not keep the dummy buffer.
            (closes #6649)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1384: no ATTENTION prompt for :vimgrep first match file · vim/vim@8ce4b7e
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1384: no ATTENTION prompt for :vimgrep first match file · vim/vim@8ce4b7e
attachments.text: Problem: No ATTENTION prompt for :vimgrep first match file. Solution: When there is an existing swap file do not keep the dummy buffer. (closes #6649)

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/994b89d28dc54c896e00eba66e247addb0540272|patch 8.2.1386: backslash not removed afer space with space in 'isfname'>
patch 8.2.1386: backslash not removed afer space with space in 'isfname'

Problem:    Backslash not removed afer space in option with space in
            'isfname'.
Solution:   Do remove backslash before space, also when it is in 'isfname'.
            (Yasuhiro Matsumoto, closes #6651)

patch 8.2.1387: Vim9: cannot assign to single letter variable with type

Problem:    Vim9: cannot assign to single letter variable with type.
Solution:   Exclude the colon from the variable name. (closes #6647)

attachments.title: patch 8.2.1387: Vim9: cannot assign to single letter variable with type · vim/vim@95dd9f2
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: cannot assign to single letter variable with type. Solution: Exclude the colon from the variable name. (closes #6647)

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/dd29f1b0569cca253c80856eda2e85e04c1e0627|patch 8.2.1388: Vim9: += only works for numbers>
patch 8.2.1388: Vim9: += only works for numbers

Problem:    Vim9: += only works for numbers.
Solution:   Use += as concatenate for a list. (closes #6646)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1388: Vim9: += only works for numbers · vim/vim@dd29f1b
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1388: Vim9: += only works for numbers · vim/vim@dd29f1b
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: += only works for numbers. Solution: Use += as concatenate for a list. (closes #6646)

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/1c199f9c70446933677d5210f34d2b86eefa2a43|patch 8.2.1390: Vim9: type error after storing an option value>
patch 8.2.1390: Vim9: type error after storing an option value

Problem:    Vim9: type error after storing an option value.
Solution:   Drop the type after a STOREOPT instruction. (closes #6632)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1390: Vim9: type error after storing an option value · vim/vim@1c199f9
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1390: Vim9: type error after storing an option value · vim/vim@1c199f9
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: type error after storing an option value. Solution: Drop the type after a STOREOPT instruction. (closes #6632)

patch 8.2.1391: Vim9: no error for shadowing a script function

patch 8.2.1395: Vim9: no error if declaring a funcref with lower case letter

Problem:    Vim9: no error if declaring a funcref with a lower case letter.
Solution:   Check the name after the type is inferred. Fix confusing name.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/5a849da57c5fb54ffcffd436a9e00ef40fdf094c|patch 8.2.1396: Vim9: no error for unexpectedly returning a value>
patch 8.2.1396: Vim9: no error for unexpectedly returning a value

Problem:    Vim9: no error for unexpectedly returning a value.
Solution:   Only set the return type for lambda's.  Make using function type
            in a function reference work.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1396: Vim9: no error for unexpectedly returning a value · vim/vim@5a849da
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1396: Vim9: no error for unexpectedly returning a value · vim/vim@5a849da
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: no error for unexpectedly returning a value. Solution: Only set the return type for lambda's. Make using function type in a function reference work.
